Package com.github.actionfx.core.view.graph

Class NodeWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.view.graph.NodeWrapper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ControlWrapper
    public class NodeWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper around a Node (or other objects inside a scene graph, e.g. Tab that does not inherit from Node) to provide a unique access to certain properties, e.g. to the children list (just for nodes of type Parent).
    Author:
    koster

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  NodeWrapper.AnchorPaneAttacher
      Attacher that positions a node inside an AnchorPane.
      static class  NodeWrapper.BorderPaneAttacher
      Attacher that positions a node in a BorderPane.
      static class  NodeWrapper.ColRowAttacher
      Specialized attacher for GridPane nodes, where the node can be attached at a specified column and row.
      static class  NodeWrapper.DefaultAttacher
      Simple attacher that supports single child wrapper like ScrollPane (and its content property) as well as node derived from Parent.
      static class  NodeWrapper.ListAttacher
      Attaches a node to a list at a specified position.
      static class  NodeWrapper.ListFirstAttacher
      Attaches a node as first element to a list.
      static class  NodeWrapper.ListLastAttacher
      Attaches a node as last element to a list.
      static interface  NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher
      Interface for attaching a node to the node wrapper's children at a specified position.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NodeWrapper​(java.lang.Object node)
      Constructor accepting the node to wrap.

        Returns:
        the node wrapper instance

      • getWrapped

        public <T> T getWrapped()
        Gets the wrapped instance.
        Returns:
        the wrapped instance

      • getWrappedType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getWrappedType()
        Gets the node type of the wrapped instance.
        Returns:
        the node type

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the ID of the wrapped node. In case the node does not inherit from Node, we try to access a field with name "id" of the wrapped type.
        Returns:
        the ID of the wrapped node.

      • attachNode

        public void attachNode​(java.lang.Object node,
                       NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher attacher)
        Attaches the given node to the wrapped node, using the supplied NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher strategy.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to attach
        attacher - the attacher strategy

      • isParent

        public boolean isParent()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is of type Parent and can have children.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if the wrapped node is of type Parent.

      • isGridPane

        public boolean isGridPane()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is a GridPane and where its children are addressable by column and row.
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a GridPane, false otherwise.

      • isBorderPane

        public boolean isBorderPane()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is a BorderPane and where its children are addressable by the position inside the border layout (TOP, LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, BOTTOM).
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a BorderPane, false otherwise.

      • isAnchorPane

        public boolean isAnchorPane()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is a AnchorPane and where its child can be positioned to fully fill the anchor pane.
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a BorderPane, false otherwise.

      • isTabPane

        public boolean isTabPane()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is a TabPane.
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a TabPane, false otherwise.

      • isTab

        public boolean isTab()
        Checks, whether the wrapped object is a Tab.
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a Tab, false otherwise.

      • isOfType

        public boolean isOfType​(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Checks, whether the wrapped type is of the given clazz.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the type to check
        Returns:
        true, if the class is of the given type, false otherwise.

      • getChildren

        public <T> javafx.collections.ObservableList<T> getChildren()
        Returns the children list of this node. In case the node does not have a children list, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the children list (never null.

      • getSingleChildProperty

        public <T> javafx.beans.property.Property<T> getSingleChildProperty()
        Returns the single property containing the only child of this node. In case the node does not have a single child property, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the property containing the child

      • supportsMultipleChildren

        public boolean supportsMultipleChildren()
        Checks, whether the wrapped Node supports multiple children. This is NOT the case e.g. for a ScrollPane that only accepts a single node in attribute content as child.
        Returns:
        true, if the node supports multiple children, false, if the node supports only a single child.

      • supportsSingleChild

        public boolean supportsSingleChild()
        Checks, whether the wrapped Node supports a single child only. This is the case e.g. for a ScrollPane that only accepts a single node in attribute content as child.
        Returns:
        true, if the node supports a single child, false, if the node supports only multiple children.

      • isLeafNode

        public boolean isLeafNode()
        Checks, whether the wrapped Node is a leaf node that does not accept any children.
        Returns:
        true, if the wrapped node is a leaf node, false otherwise.

      • getWindow

        public javafx.stage.Window getWindow()
        Gets the Window where the wrapped node is currently displayed in. In case the node has not yet been displayed, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Window in that this view is displayed, or null, in case the node has not yet been displayed.

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Gets the Scene that the wrapped node is part of. In case the node has not yet been added to a scene, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Scene that the wrapped node is part of, or null, in case the node has not been added to a scene.

      • lookup

        public NodeWrapper lookup​(java.lang.String id)
        Looks up a node by its id in the scene graph hierarchy. In case there is no node with the given id, null is returned. Unlike the Node.lookup(String) method, id must not be prefixed by #.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the node to search for
        Returns:
        the found node, or null, if the node with id can not be found.

      • applyNodeVisitorByDFS

        public void applyNodeVisitorByDFS​(NodeVisitor nodeVisitor)
        Applies the given NodeVisitor to this node and all children nodes of the graph by using a Depth-First Search approach.
        Parameters:
        nodeVisitor - the node visitor to apply

      • applyNodeVisitorByBFS

        public void applyNodeVisitorByBFS​(NodeVisitor nodeVisitor)
        Applies the given NodeVisitor to this node and all children nodes of the graph by using a Breadth-First Search approach.
        Parameters:
        nodeVisitor - the node visitor to apply

      • traverseRecursivelyByDFS

        public boolean traverseRecursivelyByDFS​(NodeWrapper parent,
                                        NodeWrapper node,
                                        NodeVisitor nodeVisitor)
        Traverse the scene graph recursively by using a Depth-First Search approach, starting with parent and applies the given NodeVisitor.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent of node (or null in case node is the root node)
        node - the node to start scene graph traversal with
        nodeVisitor - the node visitor to apply during scene graph traversal
        Returns:
        true, if the complete scene graph has been traversed, false, in case the scene graph traversal has been cancelled by the supplied NodeVisitor.

      • traverseByBFS

        public static boolean traverseByBFS​(NodeWrapper root,
                                    NodeVisitor nodeVisitor)
        Traverse the scene graph recursively by using a Breadth-First Search approach, starting with parent and applies the given NodeVisitor.
        Parameters:
        root - the root node to start breadth-first search traversal for
        nodeVisitor - the node visitor to apply during scene graph traversal
        Returns:
        true, if the complete scene graph has been traversed, false, in case the scene graph traversal has been cancelled by the supplied NodeVisitor.

      • defaultAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher defaultAttacher()
        Generates a NodeWrapper.DefaultAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper. A default attacher simply adds a node to the children list (in case of multiple children) or to the child property (in case of a single child).

        In case you need a more sophisticated attaching strategy, you should use a different NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher for attaching a node to your NodeWrapper instance.

        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • listAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher listAttacher​(int index)
        Generates a NodeWrapper.ListAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Parameters:
        index - the index that the node shall be attached to
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • listLastAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher listLastAttacher()
        Generates a NodeWrapper.ListLastAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • listFirstAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher listFirstAttacher()
        Generates a NodeWrapper.ListFirstAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • colRowAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher colRowAttacher​(int column,
                                                      int row)
        Generates a NodeWrapper.ColRowAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • borderPaneAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher borderPaneAttacher​(BorderPanePosition position)
        Generates a NodeWrapper.BorderPaneAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Parameters:
        position - the position inside the BorderPane that the node shall be attached to
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • nodeAttacherFor

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher nodeAttacherFor​(NodeWrapper wrapper,
                                                       AFXNestedView nestedView)
        Determines the best node attacher for the configured AFXNestedView annotation.
        Parameters:
        wrapper - the node wrapper
        nestedView - the AFXNestedView
        Returns:
        the NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher for the supplied AFXNestedView annotation

      • anchorPaneAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher anchorPaneAttacher​(double leftAnchor,
                                                          double topAnchor,
                                                          double rightAnchor,
                                                          double bottomAnchor)
        Generates a NodeWrapper.AnchorPaneAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper.
        Parameters:
        leftAnchor - the left anchor to set
        topAnchor - the top anchor to set
        rightAnchor - the right anchor to set
        bottomAnchor - the bottom anchor to set
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher

      • anchorPaneFillingAttacher

        public static NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher anchorPaneFillingAttacher()
        Generates a NodeWrapper.AnchorPaneAttacher for attaching a node to this wrapper. The node attached will be configured to fully fill the anchor pane, i.e. the node itself will be stretched to the size of the anchor pane.
        Returns:
        the generated node attacher
